subject: Re: [junit] ClasspathWalker
msgSnippet: ... Bingo, Now we agree! In my descriptions of the Listener I wasn t even thinking about Event objects, I was thinking more in terms of my recent GUI work
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>I re-read what I wrote and it was garbage. Let me try again.
>
>We have a ClasspathWalker that generates events that some ClasspathwalkerListener consumes and operates on.
>
>I suggest testing each of these behaviors in isolation.
>
>* The ClasspathWalker correctly walks the classpath.
>* The ClasspathWalker correctly generates events as it walks the classpath.
>* The ClasspathWalkerListener correctly handles the various kinds of ClasspathWalker events
>
>To test the first and second behavior, mock the classpath. To test the third behavior, simply create events and send them to the listener. No mocking required.
>
>That was what I was trying to say. I hope this is clearer and actually makes sense.
>
>Tae care.
>
>
>
Bingo,

Now we agree!

In my descriptions of the "Listener" I wasn't even thinking about Event
objects, I was thinking more in terms of my recent GUI work using MVC.
I forgot about simply calling the handleEvent(Event e) function with a
fully featured event.
